line_1: And shew where honour bled in every scar
line_2: In pompous strain fight o'er th' extinguish'd war,

line_1: Full many a hero bore a glorious scar;
line_2: There clad in rough habiliments of war

line_1: For I turn cauld as death when he shows them a scar.
line_2: Then I steal ben the house while they talk o' the war,

line_1: The Swordman, yet unmark'd with honor'd Scar,
line_2: Routs Poets too, with Criticisms of War:

line_1: The hardy veteran, proud of many a scar,
line_2: The manly charms and honours of the war,

line_1: And stamp'd his valour with a glorious scar.
line_2: Honour and fame in time of hostile war; —

line_1: And pale was his visage, deep mark'd with a scar;
line_2: That melted in love, and that kindled in war!

line_1: And show an honest pride in ev'ry scar;
line_2: Inur'd by this, they seek a nobler war,

line_1: My Chloe still can shew the scar,
line_2: And boasts the God's peculiar care.
